content:
ICompensatableActivity Interface

Definition

Defines the interface required by an Activity that can be compensated.

In this Article

[System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated.  Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")]
public interface ICompensatableActivity

Remarks

Note

This material discusses types and namespaces that are obsolete. For more information, see Deprecated Types in Windows Workflow Foundation 4.5.

For more information about compensation, see Using Transactions in Workflows.

Methods

Compensate(ActivityExecutionContext)

Called by the workflow runtime to compensate an activity that is in the Closed state. The activity must have a value of Succeeded for its stem.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity.ExecutionResult* property in order to be compensatable.

public System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityExecutionStatus Compensate (System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityExecutionContext executionContext);
executionContext
ActivityExecutionContext

The ActivityExecutionContext for the operation.

Returns
ActivityExecutionStatus

The ActivityExecutionStatus after operation has been tried.
